page.title: 09HOUSING IN SHALBOURNE AREA
page.content: The earliest houses were built round {cruck beams,}curved timbers joined at one end, the other forming a triangle with the ground as a base. Even when these cottages have been encapsulated by brickwork and extended, the cruck beams can still be seen inside, and blackened, showing that when they were built they had a hole in the roof instead of chimneys. Many of the now single houses were once two or three cottages. There are{7 council bunga- {lows for the elderly}as well as about {20 council houses,}some of which have been purchased. There has been little or no new building in the village in the last fourteen years, but before that about twelve bungalows and four private houses were built on what was farm land. Several recent applications for infilling have been refused but in the last 6 months one has been allowed
